note.p: Birth: 22 Old Burlington Street, London, England (15 May 1847)
Death: 44 Oakley Street, Chelsea, London (15 August 1929)
Education: St Paul's School; Cambridge; Oxford. MA (Oxford)

Career: Fellow and Lecturer, Exeter College, Oxford; Professor of Zoology and Comparative Anatomy, University College, London (1874-1890); Linacre Professor of Comparative Anatomy, Oxford (1891-1898); Director, Natural History Departments, British Museum (1896-1907)
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series B 1930 vol 106 pp x-xv, plate, by Edwin Stephen Goodrich
References: Sir John Boyd, 'Sleeping Sickness: the Castellani-Bruce Controversy' in NR 1973-4 vol 28 pp 93-110
Vanity Fair 12 January 1905 - "His religion is the worship of all sorts of winged and finny freaks" by 'Spy'
